dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1721 IS: Energy Freedom Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Lee introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal green energy tax subsidies.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Energy Freedom Act.

Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; etc.
Sec. 2. Energy efficient home improvement credit repealed.
Sec. 3. Residential clean energy credit repealed.
Sec. 4. Previously-owned clean vehicles credit repealed.
Sec. 5. Alternative fuel vehicle refueling property credit repealed.
Sec. 6. Clean vehicle credit repealed.
Sec. 7. Second generation biofuel producer credit.
Sec. 8. Repeal of incentives for biodiesel, renewable diesel, and alternative fuels.
Sec. 9. Sustainable aviation fuel credit repealed.
Sec. 10. Electricity produced from certain renewable resources credit repealed.
Sec. 11. New energy efficient home credit repealed.
Sec. 12. Carbon oxide sequestration credit repealed.
Sec. 13. Zero-emission nuclear power production credit repealed.
Sec. 14. Clean hydrogen production credit repealed.
Sec. 15. Qualified commercial clean vehicles credit repealed.
Sec. 16. Advanced manufacturing production credit repealed.
Sec. 17. Clean electricity production credit repealed.
Sec. 18. Clean fuel production credit repealed.
Sec. 19. Energy credit repealed.
Sec. 20. Qualifying advanced energy project credit repealed.
Sec. 21. Clean electricity investment credit repealed.
Sec. 22. Energy efficient commercial buildings deduction repealed.
Sec. 23. Repeal on tax on petroleum.
Sec. 24. Repeal of sections relating to elective payment for energy property and electricity produced from certain renewable resources; transfer of credits.

section.header: Energy efficient home improvement credit repealed

subsection.text: Subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking section 25C (and by striking the item relating to such section in the table of sections for such subpart).

paragraph.text: Section 1016(a) is amended by striking paragraph (33).
Section 6213(g)(2) is amended by striking subparagraphs (R) and (S).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.

section.header: Energy efficient commercial buildings deduction repealed

subsection.text: Part VI of subchapter B of chapter 1 is amended by striking section 179D (and by striking the item relating to such section in the table of sections for such part).

paragraph.text: Section 263(a)(1) is amended by striking subparagraph (J).
Section 312(k)(3)(B) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.header: Treatment of amounts deductible under section 179, 179B, 179C, or 179E
subparagraph.text: For purposes of computing the earnings and profits of a corporation, any amount deductible under section 179, 179B, 179C, or 179E shall be allowed as a deduction ratably over the period of 5 taxable years (beginning with the taxable year for which such amount is deductible under section 179, 179B, 179C, or 179E, as the case may be).

paragraph.text: Section 1016(a) is amended by striking paragraph (31).
Section 1245(a) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)(C), by striking 179D,, and
in paragraph (3)(C), by striking 179D,.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2025.
Chapter 38 is amended by striking subchapter A (and by striking the item relating to such subchapter in the table of subchapters for such chapter).

paragraph.text: Section 4671(c) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Exemptions for substances taxed under section 4661
subsection.text: No tax shall be imposed by this section on the sale or use of any substance if tax is imposed on such sale or use under section 4661.

paragraph.text: Section 9507(b) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking 4611, 4661, and inserting 4661, and
by striking the flush matter at the end.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on January 1, 2026.

section.header: Repeal of sections relating to elective payment for energy property and electricity produced from certain renewable resources; transfer of credits

subsection.text: Subchapter B of chapter 65 is amended by striking sections 6417 and 6418 (and by striking the items relating to such sections in the table of sections for such subchapter).

paragraph.text: Section 39(a) is amended by striking paragraph (4).

Section 50(d) is amended by striking In the case of a real estate investment trust making an election under section 6418, paragraphs (1)(B) and (2)(B) of the section 46(e) referred to in paragraph (1) of this subsection shall not apply to any investment credit property of such real estate investment trust to which such election applies.
Section 56A(c)(9) is amended by striking or 6417.
Section 13801 of Public Law 117–169 is amended by striking subsection (f).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
